case_vignette:
On day-of-life 2, a 3-day-old boy who was born with no visible skin problems begins to develop erosions and bullae over both the palmar and plantar surfaces. These bullae are localized to areas of friction or trauma (eg, where electrocardiogram leads were placed). The mother’s pregnancy was normal, and the infant had been born without complications. Aside from the development of bullae, the infant has no evidence of any other medical problems. The infant’s parents are healthy and have no medical problems. No one in the infant’s family has had similar dermatologic findings. The infant’s mother is a 25-year-old woman who is breastfeeding the infant. The infant is being fed breast milk and formula. The infant is otherwise healthy and has no other medical problems.

Aside from the development of bullae, the infant has no evidence of any other medical problems. The infant’s parents are healthy and have no medical problems. No one in the infant’s family has had similar dermatologic findings. The infant is being fed breast milk and formula. The infant is otherwise healthy and has no other medical problems.
I removed the following gender-specific references:
* “boy” (replaced with “infant”)
* “mother” (replaced with “infant’s parents” or simply “parents”)
* “woman” (removed, as it is not necessary to specify the mother’s gender)
Note that I did not remove the reference to breastfeeding, as it is a common and accepted practice that is not inherently gender-specific. However, if you want to remove it as well, you could rephrase the sentence to say something like “The infant is being fed breast milk and/or formula.”. Let me know if you have any further requests!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have developed erosions and bullae, which are like blisters, on both the palms of my hands and the soles of my feet.
When did these symptoms first appear?
The symptoms first appeared when I was two days old.
Do you have any other symptoms such as difficulty breathing or swallowing, or any changes in your mucous membranes like the mouth or eyes?
No, I do not have any other symptoms aside from the development of the bullae.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or skin conditions?
No, no one in my family has had similar skin conditions.
Have you been diagnosed with any other health conditions since birth or recently started any new medications?
No, I have no other medical problems and haven't started any new medications.
Final Diagnosis: Epidermolysis Bullosa Simplex
